intro: Erigeron darrellianus, commonly known as Darrell's fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall. Erigeron darrellianus is often found in California and adjacent regions, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
